intro: Henckelia simplex, commonly known as the simple henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
